intro: Telis hamosa, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are hairy and branching. Telis hamosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and natural landscapes.
